result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay A O'Laughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Provide a DNA Sample and have picture and prints taken for this case.  
Restitution of $800 was paid to the victim directly in court at sentencing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay A O'Laughlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: judgment of conviction returned
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission - already on file
modified restitution order/  paid directly to the victim in court

Defendant Jay A O'Laughlin in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge made written decision previously.  Found guilty.  Defense has family members to make statement.  GE sister of defendant makes a statement to the court about her brother.  Victim impact statement provide to the court.  Restitution Report and Order provided.  Victim PE addresses the court today.  Objection by defense "possibilities" of what could have happened not what did, etc....Judge states he can hear this,  this is not a restitution hearing.  It's a victim's impact.  ADA White puts her recommendation on record of :  $100 plus costs.  $1214.82 restitution requested.  30 days jail and DNA surcharge and sample.  Defense argues about the amount of restitution.  Off record conversations take place.  Back on record, there's an offer to accept $800 for restitution and the state will waive the Victim witness surcharge.  Agreed.  Brief recess taken for defendant to go to financial institution for the money.  
3:15pm back on record,  $800 cash paid today directly to the victim in court.  Defense asks for just a fine with no jail.  Judge orders:  $20 warrant fee, $500 plus costs.  DNA surcharge and sample.  10 days jail, good time.
notice of hearing returned
Sentencing hearing on August 29, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
additional restitution attachments

Motion to dismiss made by Attny Mazza. Arguments by Attny White.  Court believes 4 corners of complaint meets criteria.  Clinton G. sworn and testifies for the State.  Objection - direct continued.  Objection - overruled.  Direct. Objection - sustained.  Court questions witness.  Video shown to Court.  Cross-exam by Attny Mazza.  Objection.  Cros continued.  Re-direct.  Paul E. sworn and testified for the State.  Cross-exam.  Re-direct.  Ray B. sworn and testified for the State.  Objection - irrelevant - overruled.  Cross-exam.  Court questions witness.  Cross continued.  Clinton G. resumes the stand indicates there was a seperate body-cam disc prepared.  State rests.  Court will review defendants prior record.  Arguments by DA White and Attny Mazza.  Court makes a statement.  Jay O'Laughlin sworn and testifies as the defendant.  Cross exam by DA White.  Re-direct.  Re-Cross.  Court will make written decision after reading the sights quoted by defense counsel.  Court will make a written decision.  Exhibit #1 - offered and received into evidence.
